newsitem.title: UK: UK retail sales fall 0.6 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: UK retail sales fall 0.6 pct in July.

text.p: The Office for National Statistics (ONS) released the following seasonally adjusted data on UK retail sales in July.
Market forecasts had centred on a 0.2 percent rise in retail sales on the month and a year-on-year increase of 2.9 percent.
BY SECTOR (percentage gain, minus indicates fall)

The average weekly non-seasonally adjusted value of retail sales in July was 3.16 billion stg, 5.6 percent up on July 1995. In value terms, retail sales rose by 5.9 percent in the three months to end July on the same period a year earlier.

The ONS said the 2.7 percent rise in sales over the three months to the end of July, compared with the same period a year ago, was the highest rise since December 1994, although it was equal with the 2.7 percent 3mth/3mth year ago rise seen in June.
The ONS said the 2.2 percent fall in textile, clothing and footwear sales in July was mainly due to a drop in clothing sales.
